title: Stocks are on track for their worst week of 2019
text: The Dow drops 200 points. Are the market's cracks spreading? With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman, Steve Grasso and Dan Nathan.

title: China’s Huawei sues US government
text: Barron’s senior tech writer Jon Swartz discusses how Huawei is suing the U.S. government over a law that bans federal agencies from buying its products and the ongoing 5G race.

title: Fair.com CEO Sees Car Market Booming, Says Tesla Has Become Mature Product
text: Scott Painter, Fair.com chief executive officer, discusses the shifting world of auto sales and his views on Tesla Inc. and Uber Technologies Inc. with Bloomberg's Taylor Riggs on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: Airbnb to buy HotelTonight as it battles hotels and online travel agencies
text: Airbnb is acquiring hotel booking site HotelTonight as it builds an expansion narrative ahead of an eventual IPO.

title: Airbnb to buy HotelTonight for an undisclosed amount
text: CNBC's Deirdre Bosa reports on Airbnb acquiring HotelTonight for an undisclosed amount. It's Airbnb's biggest push into the hotel industry.

title: Chinese tech giant Huawei sues the US over ban
text: Alexis Keenan of Yahoo Finance reports on Huawei's decision to sue the United States over a product ban.

title: Breaking Down Lyft's Valuation: An Interactive Analysis
text: Lyft recently filed for an IPO, making public the S-1 it had confidentially filed with the SEC a few months back. The company is reportedly aiming for a valuation of $20 – 25 billion, and could go public within the next month. In this note we examine what its fundamental value is.

title: Huawei poses a huge national security risk to US: Sean Spicer
text: Former White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer on mounting concerns over Huawei, U.S. trade negotiations with China and the House Judiciary Committee's investigation into President Trump.

title: Pisani: Fed pause, trade deal already priced into market
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani looks ahead at the day's market action including the ECB announcement and what he thinks is leading the market downturn.

title: Cramer urges investors to find the positives in crushed stocks
text: CNBC's Jim Cramer makes the case that investors should remain optimistic despite poor earnings reports.

title: Huawei Wages Legal and PR Battle on Behalf of CFO
text: The Supreme Court of British Columbia in Vancouver set a date of May 8 for Huawei Technologies Co. Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou's extradition hearing. Bloomberg's Tom Mackenzie reports on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Jack Dorsey spends $10K a week on bitcoin, predicts a 'massive' bitcoin boom
text: Jack Dorsey makes a very big bitcoin bet. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Brian Kelly, Chris Verrone and Steve Grasso.

title: President Trump hosts workforce policy meeting - March 6, 2019
text: President Trump participates in an American Workforce Policy Advisory Board Meeting.

title: Jim Cramer: When Is it Time to Sacrifice a Stock?
text: When you have to sacrifice a stock, how do you know which stock to let go?

title: Ex-Cisco CEO Chambers Sees India Growing Fastest, Expresses Concern About China
text: John Chambers, founder of JC2 Ventures LLC and former chief executive officer of Cisco Systems Inc., discusses the outlook for the global economy with Bloomberg's Shery Ahn and Amanda Lang on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: US credit card debt hits record $870B
text: Barron's Associate Publisher Jack Otter on the rise in U.S. credit card debt and its impact on the economy.

title: Samsung is already planning more foldable phones
text: If you, for some unknown reason, thought Samsung's flexible device rollout would stop with the Galaxy Fold then we have bad news.

title: The Future of Cryptocurrency amid the rise of institutional investors
text: This year will be big for cryptocurrency custodians as institutional investors get more into the trading of digital currencies, according to crypto storage device maker Ledger.

title: Workforce board can help close skills gap, says CEO
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team breaks down President Donald Trump's meeting at the White House with business CEOs, with Tony Fratto, former White House press secretary, and Steve Odland, CEO of The Conference Board.

title: Credit card debt closes 2018 at $870B
text: Matt Schulz chief industry analyst at Compare Cards discusses credit card debt reaching close to $1 trillion dollars.

title: Eventually the market will rally to new highs: Strategist
text: Raymond James Chief Strategist Jeff Saut on the state of the markets.

title: Boring Company proposes tunnel in Las Vegas
text: CNBC's Contessa Brewer reports on Elon Musk's Boring Company and its proposal to build an underground tunnel to connect Las Vegas' strip as well as potentially Las Vegas to Los Angeles.

title: If Lyft's IPO does well, so will Uber's, says expert
text: The "Squawk Alley" team discusses the market sell-off's effects on tech stocks with Eric Hippeau, managing partner at Lerer Hippeau, and Michael Morris, tech analyst at Guggenheim.

title: Why the Bugatti La Voiture Noire costs $19 Million
text: Bugatti has just unveiled its brand new custom supercar. The Bugatti La Voiture Noire debuted at the 2019 Geneva Motor Show and is the most expensive new car ever sold.

title: Oil Analyst Streible Says Three Factors Can Lead to a Market Rally
text: In "Futures In Focus," Phil Streible, senior market strategist at RJO Futures, discusses the factors needed to produce an oil market rally. He speaks with Bloomberg's Vonnie Quinn on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: Negotiating a trade deal based on market performance is a bad idea, says expert
text: Peter Cecchini, global chief market strategist at Cantor Fitzgerald, and Kevin Caron, senior portfolio manager at Washington Crossing Advisors, join "Squawk on the Street" to discuss the biggest factors weighing on the markets.

title: Pisani: Banks, semiconductors, industrials among market leaders
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani looks ahead at the day's market action.

title: Who Should Consider a Backdoor Roth IRA?
text: Christine Benz explains this maneuver for investors who are over the income limits for contributing to an IRA.

title: Video games of the future will build themselves
text: AI in video games is very different than the AI in self-driving cars, smart home devices, and natural language algorithms. That’s because game developers have been sticking to the basics, but all that is starting to change.

title: White House to host CEOs for workforce advisory meeting
text: The White House is hosting a meeting with major CEOs to get their ideas about how to innovate and train a new workforce.

title: Elon Musk's Boring Company proposes tunnel project in Las Vegas
text: The "Squawk Box" news team discusses some of the morning's most provocative headlines.

title: Boxed's transition to automation has created jobs, CEO Says
text: Boxed Chief Executive Officer Chieh Huang discusses the startup's transition to fully-automated fulfillment centers and how it is taking on retail and tech giants like Amazon.com Inc. and Target Corp. He speaks with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: TransferWise CEO doesn't see a reason to go public right now
text: TransferWise Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Kristo Kaarmann discusses the money transfer service's funding and growth plans with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Bugatti unveils $18.9M 'La Voiture Noire' at Geneva auto show
text: Jen Rogers, Melody Hahm and Myles Udland of Yahoo Finance  discuss La Voiture Noire' the world's most expensive car that was unveiled at the Geneva Auto Show.

title: Here's why traders are listening to one hedge fund manager's warning about the market
text: Stocks stall out. Are global recession fears for real? With CNBC's Scott Wapner and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman, Dan Nathan and Mark Tepper.

title: Gulf Bonds a safe place for emerging-market investors to hide
text: Sovereign bonds in the six-nation Gulf Cooperation Council are set to be buoyed by billions of dollars in inflows from their inclusion in JPMorgan Chase & Co's emerging-market indexes.

title: More than 220 companies are seeking to go public in 2019
text: Steve Vassallo, Foundation Capital general partner, and CNBC's Bob Pisani join "Squawk Alley" to discuss the wave of IPOs that are expected in 2019.

title: Why the 10 year bull market almost didn't happen
text: Jared Blikre of Yahoo Finance breaks down the 10 year bull market with Yahoo Finance's Adam Shapiro, Julie Hyman, Rick Newman and Tendayi Kapfidze of Lending Tree.

title: Jim Cramer: China trade talks may go on for months
text: CNBC's Jim Cramer, David Faber and Carl Quintanilla discuss the latest developments in the US-China trade wars.

title: December new home sales rise to 7-month high
text: CNBC's Diana Olick reports on new home sales for the month of December, which increased 3.7 percent to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 621,000 units, the highest level since May 2018.

title: Democrats target financial services with Wall Street Tax Act
text: Senator Brian Schatz and Congressman Peter DeFazio will introduce new legislation to tax transactions of stocks, bonds and derivatives at 0.1 percent.

title: Pisani: Discount stores, home improvement among retail winners
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani looks ahead at the day's market action.

title: How a global growth slowdown could affect the market
text: Phil Camporeale, asset allocation strategist at JPMorgan Asset Management, joins "Squawk Box" to discuss how a potential global slowdown might affect markets.

title: Every Day The Global Central Banker Experiment Pushes On We Can't Help But Feel Things Are Not Right
text: Are negative interest rates a function of investor flight to safety and underlying pessimism or is supply simply being absorbed by central banks and driving up prices due to a lack of liquidity? Time will tell.

title: Where Lerer Hippeau is finding investment opportunities
text: Lerer Hippeau Ventures Managing Director Eric Hippeau discusses Lyft Inc.'s planned initial public offering and the venture capital firm's investment strategy with Bloomberg's Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Bigger Countries Aren't Always the Healthiest or Happiest
text: Big countries are falling behind in rankings of global health, wealth and happiness. A new Global Wellness Index ranks Canada as the best country out of 151 nations. It scored well for blood pressure, life expectancy and government healthcare spending. The U.S. came in at number 37.

title: Huawei CFO sues Canada over her arrest
text: Huawei Technologies Co. Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou is suing the Canadian government for allegedly trampling her constitutional rights during her arrest in an effort to discredit the extradition case she’s facing.

title: Pax Labs CEO Bharat Vasan says that nothing in consumer packaged goods in the next 50 to 100 years will be bigger than marijuana.
text: CEO Of Popular Marijuana-Vape Startup On Changing The Industry

title: Fintech founder explains how to consciously invest with Coin app
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team explores how conscious investing works with John Hancock's new investing app, with Meghan Schleck, analyst at John Hancock and founder of Coin, a start-up the firm is backing.

title: More women needed in construction to fill demand
text: Kim Roy Hitt Contracting CEO discusses the construction outlook for 2019 and how women are needed to fill job demands with Adam Shapiro, Julie Hyman and Brian Sozzi of Yahoo Finance.
